dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Sam, look at this! I found something interesting in the box from our old house.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: What is it? A music box?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Yes! It's very old. Can you guess the age?

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Maybe fifty years? It looks beautiful. Does it play music?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: I don't know. Let me try... Yes! It plays a little song.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: That's wonderful! Wait... I hear something inside. Something is moving.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: You're right! I think there's a piece of paper in here.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Can you open it? We need to be careful.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: I'm trying, but it's difficult. The top won't open.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Here, let me help. We can do this together.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Good idea! You control that side, and I'll control this side.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: It's opening! Look, there's a letter inside!

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: What does it say? Can you read it?

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: It says 'Dear daughter, this music box is now yours. Remember our good days together. Love, your mother.'

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: That's so beautiful. But who is the daughter?

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: I believe this was from my grandmother! She gave this to my mother.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Really? Do you remember her?

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: A little. She enjoyed music very much. She played the piano every day.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: This is a special discovery. Will you save the letter?

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Yes, I will save both the letter and the music box. They're very important to me now.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: I'm happy we found this together. It's a good feeling.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Thank you for your support, Alex. This means so much to me.
